name: Holistic & Psychic Expo, June 4-5, 2016
description:
Come join us for the Intuitives Interactive Holistic & Psychic Expo! The largest event of its kind in Michigan!
NOW TWO DAYS LONG! Saturday-Sunday, June 4-5, 2016

NEW LOCATION: 
The beautiful EMU Student Center
Eastern Michigan University in Ypsilanti (next-door to Ann Arbor)
900 Oakwood Street, 2nd floor Ballroom and Auditorium 
(ground floor as you enter from the parking lot)
Ypsilanti, MI 48197

SPONSORED BY: Body Mind Spirit Guide & Body Mind Spirit Radio, Crazy Wisdom Bookstore & Tea Room, and the Enlightened Soul Center

SATURDAY, JUNE 4, 2016 - 10:00 am - 8:00 pm
Doors open 9:30 am for registration on Saturday.
SUNDAY, JUNE 5, 2016 - 11:00 am - 5:00 pm
Doors open 10:30 am for registration on Sunday

ADMISSION: 
$10 for one day or 
$15 for a weekend pass
Kids 12-18 yrs: $5 daily pass / Under 12 free 
Includes FREE presentations! 
FREE PARKING at designated lots

READINGS: There will be Mediums, Psychics, Tarot & Angel Card Readers, Intuitive & Channeled Readings, Palm Readings. 
SPECIALTY READINGS: Crystal Ball, Rare Hungarian Gypsy Cards, Runes, Numerology, Shamanic Stone Bowl...and more!
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!readers/e75ww

OTHER GREAT OFFERINGS INCLUDE: Aura Photography, Body & Energy Workers, Vendors of Holistic & Metaphysical Products, and More!
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!vendors/tcvqd

FEATURED PRESENTATION: 
6:30 PM SATURDAY - "Michigan Mediums: Group Gallery Reading Extravaganza" Three mediums who'll share the stage to connect the audience members with their departed loved ones: Marybeth Rombach Nelson, Kathy Tertzag, and Tom Pierce.

SCHEDULE of FREE PRESENTATIONS:
DETAILS: http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!speakers/uoauv

SATURDAY, JUNE 4:
11:00 am-12:00 pm - Juliana Schriemer
"Conscious Nutrition: Cultivating Intuition & More"
12:30-1:30 pm - Steve Schriemer
“Expanding Awareness Through Qi Gong”
2:00-3:00 pm - Christine Fodor
"Embodying Your Higher Self: Clearing the Ego"
3:30-4:30 pm - Sue Burton Hidalgo
“The House Whisperer - Feng Shui and More”
5:00-6:00 pm - Constance Hart, ND
"Rahanni Celestial Healing"
6:30-8:00 pm
"Michigan Mediums" - Group Gallery Reading Extravaganza with Marybeth Rombach Nelson, Kathy Tertzag, and Tom Pierce

SUNDAY, JUNE 5:
11:30 am-12:30 pm - Lynda Forbes
"Chinese Face-Reading: Your Health Is Written On Your Face"
1:00-2:00 pm - Wendy Piepenberg
"Mediumship Gallery Reading with Departed Loved Ones"
2:30-3:30 pm - Daphne Mead-Derbyshire
"Tidbits & Tips for the Spiritual Explorer" 
4:00-5:00 pm - Allegra Miller
"Healing Oils of the Bible"

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED! Volunteers get special perks in exchange for their dedicated service. Apply at http://www.holisticpsychicexpo.com/#!volunteer/glc6s

MAILING LIST: Join our mailing list by filling out the form at:
http://holisticpsychicexpo.com

TO APPLY FOR A BOOTH as a reader, bodyworker, or vendor:   http://holisticpsychicexpo.com - click on "Apply" in the menu.
APPLICATION DEADLINE: Friday, May 6
Late applications will be accepted until we are full, but may not be included in the program book.

Thanks and we look forward to seeing YOU and your friends at this transformative event!!!

Sunflower painting courtesy of Molly Indura, bethelight.org

name: Potters Guild Spring Sale
description: Join us on the 4th and 5th under the big tent.  Over 30 ceramic artists offering handmade works that range from dinnerware and  fuctional work to home decor, tiles and jewelery.  Find that perfect wedding or graduation gift!

name: Taste of Ann Arbor Beer Garden
description:
Arbor Brewing Company is once again setting up our own beer garden adjacent to the Taste of Ann Arbor event on the street with several of our summer's best beers on tap: Strawberry Blonde, Bavarian Bliss, Sacred Cow IPA and Anahata Chakra. The beer garden will be on Washington at Main. Beers start flowing in the garden at 11am and will feature live music by Third Coast Kinds. No cover but you must be 21 or accompanied by a parent to visit the beer garden. Beers, Sangria and soft drinks will be available for purchase with Taste of Ann Arbor Tickets.

Taste is an annual tradition in Ann Arbor. It is a strolling outdoor feast featuring taste-sized samples from dozens of restaurants, cafes and pubs. The event is free and open to the public. Tickets for food tastes and beer can be purchased on Main Street. Don't miss this opportunity to get a sample of cuisine from restaurants you've been meaning to try!

name: Taste of Ann Arbor
description:
This annual community event features local restaurants offering visitors bite size, and some not so bite size, tastes of what they do best. Tickets for food tastes can be purchased at the event for $.50 each.

****************************

We will be offering the following menu items:

Agua Frescas – 5 tickets
Chicken Momo Yakitori – 6 tickets
Elotes – 4 tickets

*****************************

Forty of Ann Arbor’s favorite restaurants will be set up on the two blocks of Main Street between William and Washington. 

Food prices range from .50 (1 ticket) to $4.00 (8 tickets), nothing is priced over $4.00!! Tickets are sold at the event by strolling ticket sellers, look for the blue aprons, and at ticket booths on Main at William and Washington.

Family fun abounds with live entertainment throughout the day served with performances at the Main & Liberty stage by:
Dan Henig
Madelyn Grant
Willa Rae & The Minor Arcana
Barelyon
Girls Who Care

More event info here: http://bit.ly/27I6q9U

name: Aventura Spring Menu Launch
description:
Your favorite dinner spot just became your favorite lunch spot.
Bringing great food, and quick service to your lunch break. Offering paella for two, Spanish flatbreads, salads, and more!
Check out the new menu with the link listed above.

name: Spring Menu Launch
description:
Experience the flavors of the season and try our new Spring menu. Featuring new food and beverages you are sure to love! 
But, don't worry we have kept some of the classics on our menu too.
You can make your reservation with OpenTable link above.

name: $5 Apple Fritter Bacon Cheese Burger
description: Our most decadent offering yet- our apple fritter donuts with a bacon cheeseburger nestled inside. Just crazy enough to be amazing, right?

name: Black Pond Woods Park Stewardship Workday-National Trails Day
description:
As part of National Trails Day come on out to experience a woods filled with oak, hickory, maple and dogwood. Volunteers will work on trails and remove invasive Garlic Mustard. This is a great park to bring families out to enjoy a day outdoors. Please meet at the Tibbits Court entrance to the park. 
Please wear long pants and closed-toe shoes. All minors must present a completed release form, and should be accompanied by a guardian. Tools, snacks and know-how are provided. Free.

name: Guided Tour - Albert Kahn: Under Construction
description:
In the last two decades there has been a tremendous swell of interest in Detroit architect Albert Kahn (1869–1942), arguably the most important architect of American industrialization. Albert Kahn: Under Construction focuses on the remarkable archive of photographs from the Highland Park Ford Plant to the Willow Run Bomber Plant. Shot by an array of professional photographers, these often striking documentary images were a novel strategy for conveying information—showing buildings as they grew on site—to busy managers at the main office. UMMA docents will explore these artifacts as photographs
and evidence of Kahn’s innovative solutions to the architectural challenges of his day.

Public exhibition tours are generously supported by the Richard and Rosann Noel Fund for Museum Education.
